talk_0079:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's just...<sp:5:0:0> Hmm. There's one problem.<sp:5:0:0>
We still need to determine how to
conduct the survey.
talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_00>Yes? What is it?


I'm busy, but I suppose I can indulge in a
moment of idle chatter.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I certainly won't have time for it once I've
uncovered the secret of the Ring Ruins.

I'll be the most in-demand scholar in the
world. Imagine it...

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>From Hebra to Lanayru, adoring fans will
call my name. "Doctor Calip!" Can you
hear them? A chorus of scholars!<sp:5:0:0>
Doctor Calip, master of the past.
Renowned genius, Doctor Calip!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>...<sp:5:0:0>Ahem.


I seem to have gotten carried away.
talk_0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_01>Ah. You again.


We're busy researching that floating
Ring Ruin. Don't get in the way.
talk_0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Y-<sp:5:0:0>you...<sp:5:0:0> It looked like you were sucked
into the Ring Ruin.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>No, impossible. Forget it. <sp:5:0:0>Forget
everything I just said.

<snd:Sad_00><sp:0:2:2:5000>These long hours must be getting to me...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_0122:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_01>Because the Demon King saw it as
a threat!<sp:5:1:0> Isn't that right?!

That only means one thing. <sp:5:0:0>We should
investigate the floating Ring Ruin
immediately!
talk_0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Think_00><sp:0:2:2:5000>All right...<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:5:0:0> <sp:0:2:2:5000>I can finally start my research on the
floating Ring Ruin...

If I manage to make a new discovery, soon the day
will come when everyone looks up to me, eyes full of
adoration... Heh heh heh...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Hmm...
talk_0091:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Chat_00>She ordered us all to stay far away
from the <clr:0000>Ring Ruin that floats <clr:ffff>above us,
no matter what.<sp:5:0:0>
I saw her myself—the princess, right
before my eyes.
talk_0125:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>But still, I know you would not misspeak,
Master Link, especially on a matter of
such importance. How confusing...
talk_0126:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Oh, pardon me. I was lost in thought.
I'd better hurry and tell everyone about
this so we can open up the ruins.
talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Honestly, I was taken aback when I heard
that Princess Zelda was an impostor.
That's a lot to swallow, you know?
But I'm so glad that I can finally start my
long-cherished research on the floating
Ring Ruin!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The only trouble is...I still can't figure out
<clr:0000>a way to see the stone slab inside<clr:ffff>. I can't
condone breaking these precious ruins.
This riddle is a tough one, to be sure.<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0800>Still, my hook's baited now, and I'm not
letting go until I get a bite!
talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Under Princess Zelda's orders, everyone
is strictly forbidden from getting close to
that ring.
If that applies to an archaeologist like me,
it certainly applies to an amateur like you.
talk_0093:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00>She <clr:0000>left as soon as she arrived<clr:ffff>. I wasn't
able to ask her anything more about
those unusual instructions.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>We thought it was to protect the villagers
from harm. This ruin does look like it
could crash down at any moment.
That's what Paya and I suspect at least.
talk_0127:
<snd:TalkPositive_00>It's clear that the <clr:0000>floating Ring Ruin <clr:ffff>that
we were forbidden to explore is a unique
and incredibly valuable find.
talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh? <sp:5:0:0>Am I imagining things? <sp:5:0:0>It looks like
you just slipped into the ruins.

No, forget I said anything. It must have
been a trick of the light.
talk_0053:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Greeting_02>I'm overjoyed that both you and Princess
Zelda are safe, Master Link.
talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:LaughS>It's a silly thought, but I wish I could see
a <clr:0000>picture of the inside<clr:ffff>.

What a fanciful idea, eh?
talk_0129:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>It was immediately after the Upheaval.


Princess Zelda came here to
Kakariko Village.
talk_0095:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_01>Oh! My apologies, Master Link!<sp:5:0:0> I was so
pleased to see you, I completely forgot
common courtesy.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Please allow me to introduce Mr. Tauro,
an esteemed member of the Zonai
Survey Team.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>I invited him here to investigate the
Ring Ruins that fell on our village.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>He has incredibly deep knowledge of the
Zonai civilization...<sp:5:0:0>

He's even familiar with Zonai script! He is
truly an incredibly talented individual.
talk_0111:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Sad_01>She ordered us not to let anyone go near
that <clr:0000>floating Ring Ruin<clr:ffff>, no matter what.
talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal>Huh?<sp:5:0:0> Did you really find a way inside the
floating Ring Ruin?!

<sp:3:0:2:0900>Sorry, but I have to get this off my chest.<sp:5:0:0>
If it were that easy to get in, I wouldn't be
in such turmoil here. I'm not buying it.
Now, if you<clr:0000> showed me a picture of
the inside<clr:ffff>, I'd believe you. That would
really help out the research team!
talk_0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Princess Zelda visited Kakariko Village
recently. Her orders were clear—of all the
Ring Ruins, this site is off-limits.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>She left before giving any sort of
reason why...<sp:5:0:0>

Maybe she wanted to keep the villagers
safe. Ruins aren't known for being
structurally sound, after all.
talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Notice>Speaking of pictures, I've heard a rumor
that Robbie made a <clr:0000>mechanism that turns
scenery into images<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>I could use it to get a good depiction of
the ruin's exterior, though what I'd really
love is to capture whatever's inside.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think>Perhaps I should go to <clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>
and have a chat with Robbie.
talk_0055:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad><sp:0:2:2:5000>I would brave some crumbling architecture if it
gave us more research material, but it's not worth
disobeying the princess.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a01>What if she stripped my title? I worked my whole life
for some recognition, and I won't give it up now!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_0097:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Several more Ring Ruins with such
a shape have fallen down around
the village.
Most have broken apart in some way.
What's fascinating is that a stone slab
with writing was found at each site.
Deciphering the text showed that each
slab contains rather interesting content,
including mention of "sages."
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>There's still so much we don't
understand...
talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh?<sp:5:0:0> It looked like you disappeared into
the ring...

But that can't be right. Ah, forget I said
anything. I must have imagined it.
talk_0098:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I think that perhaps the ruin floating in the
air also has a slab that makes mention of
the sages!
talk_0080:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>It's clear that the interior of this Ring
Ruin is hollow.

Sadly, there doesn't seem to be
an entrance.
talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh? <sp:5:0:0>It almost looked like...like you just
disappeared into the ring...

No, of course not. That's impossible.<sp:5:0:0>
Isn't it?
talk_0115:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Until now, I'd given up on investigating
the ruin, believing Princess Zelda's orders
were for the best.
But if that princess was an impostor,
that changes everything.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Princess Zelda's impostor...the Demon
King's underling...forbade anyone from
investigating the floating Ring Ruin.
That must mean that doing so would pose
a threat to the Demon King!

<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>If that is the case, we must survey that
floating Ring Ruin as soon as possible!
talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Finding out that the Princess Zelda I met
with was a pawn of the Demon King...<sp:5:0:0>
How to put this to words...<sp:5:1:0>
Let's just say it's thrown me off my
balance. It's so hard to believe.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>And yet, I do believe you, Master Link.
I could not bring myself to doubt you for
even a moment.
And if these ruins pose some kind of a
threat to the Demon King...

then we must accelerate our research at
all costs!

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>However, looking inside the ruins without
damaging them is a difficult hurdle, one
well beyond my understanding.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Please, Master Link. Lend your wisdom
to Mr. Tauro. With your help, I'm certain
a way forward will be revealed.
talk_0116:
<sp:3:0:2:0d01><snd:Happy_01>Right you are, Mr. Tauro.<sp:5:0:0> There is no
longer any reason to prohibit your
research.
Let's open up the floating Ring Ruin
at once!
talk_0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Um, Master Link? Did I see you go inside
of the floating Ring Ruin?

I just...<sp:5:0:0> N-no! Never mind! It's nothing!<sp:5:0:0>
My eyes are clearly playing tricks on me.
talk_0001: <sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>I'm so happy that I get to see you again!
talk_0019: <sp:3:0:2:0700>Of course. How silly of me.<sp:5:0:0> Ha...<sp:5:0:0>ha...
talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>The <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> are the most intriguing
ruins I've researched. Especially this one,
the way part of it <clr:0000>floats <clr:ffff>up there.
You had the foresight to focus on all of
these special ruins and invite the survey
team to take a look right away.
<snd:Happy_00><sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm impressed, Chief Paya!
talk_0119:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Hee-hee.<sp:5:0:0> Your Lurelin phrasing is coming
through, Mr. Tauro.<sp:5:0:0> You must really
be pleased!
talk_0004:
<snd:Sad_00>Oh, no, I... I'm no chief. I just couldn't
refuse my predecessor when she decided
to pass the title to me rather suddenly.
I'm really a chief in name only, since I still
have a great deal to...<sp:5:1:0> Hm?
talk_0102:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Determination_00>She must have some reason!


Until we find out Princess Zelda's true
intentions, we have no choice but to
trust her and leave that ruin alone.
talk_0103:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's such an unbelievable tale, and yet... 


I trust you completely, Master Link. It
must be as you say.

It is hard to explain, but the princess we
saw was somehow unfamiliar... It was as
though her very aura was different.
talk_0104: <sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800>Knowledge is tugging on the line!<sp:0:4:0>Time to reel in some results!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_0089:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice_01>What? <sp:5:0:0>Princess Zelda is still missing?


That just...<sp:5:0:0>confuses the matter more.<sp:5:0:0>
You see, <sp:5:0:0>I actually met with the princess
not too long ago.
talk_0071:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Are you thinking about the floating
Ring Ruin?<sp:5:0:0>

I am as well. It has been on our minds
for some time.
talk_0105:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>If the contents of the other Ring Ruins
are any indication...

There should be <clr:0000>a stone slab inside
engraved with Zonai script<clr:ffff>.
near_0004: What to do, what to do...
talk_0072:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think>We would like to suggest resuming the
research, if we may.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Have you since figured out what became
of Princess Zelda?
talk_0130:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>I can't investigate, as that would go
against Princess Zelda's direct orders.

If only I could meet with her again,
I'm sure I could persuade her to
change her mind.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>In any case, I'm having trouble squaring
your story about Princess Zelda with the
Princess Zelda we met.<sp:0:4:0>If everything is all right, why won't she
just show herself?
talk_0073:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_00>Wh-<sp:5:0:0>what?<sp:5:0:0> The Zelda who appeared after
the Upheaval was a creation of the
Demon King?
And the real Princess Zelda still hasn't
been found?

But...<sp:5:0:0> How can this be true?
talk_0108:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>First, we should look for a way to <clr:0000>confirm
that there's a stone slab inside<clr:ffff>.

However, we also don't want to damage
these precious ruins...
talk_0075:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>But if she was an impostor the whole
time...<sp:5:1:0>that would mean...<sp:0:4:0>The real reason she ordered us to close
off the floating Ring Ruin was...
talk_0109:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>Hm?<sp:5:0:0> The Zelda who appeared after
the Upheaval is an impostor born of
the Demon King?
And the real Princess Zelda is
still missing?!

<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:SurpriseS_01>Are you serious, Master Link?! It's
certainly hard to believe...

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Yet I find it impossible that you would
make up such a thing.<sp:5:0:0> Hmm...<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>Come to think of it, <sp:5:0:0>the Princess Zelda
who came to Kakariko Village...
talk_0076:
<sp:3:0:2:0d01><snd:Determination_00>You are exactly right! There is no longer
any reason to prohibit your research.

Let's open up the floating Ring Ruin at
once, Mr. Tauro!
